data.title: TV Schedules > KET
data.meta_description: Check the schedule to find out when programs are airing on KET, KET2, KETKY and KETKIDS.
data.text:
Lyla in the Loop

How to Hamster/A Bad Case of the Beeps

It is Luke's turn with the hamsters and he's planning the best weekend ever. The Loops embark on a journey to figure out why Stu is mysteriously beeping.

bookclub@ket

Payne Hollow: Life on the Fringe of Society

Host Bill Goodman and a panel of readers discuss Harlan and Anna Hubbard's simple life on the Ohio River in Trimble County. Eschewing electricity, telephones, and other trappings of the 20th century, the Hubbards tended their garden, fished the river, and lived lives akin to those of settlers a century earlier. A 2002 KET production.

Arthur

Arthur's First Sleepover/Arthur's New Year's Eve

Despite D.W.'s warning of an alien invasion, Arthur and his friends camp out in the backyard. A jealous D.W. plans a prank to scare them off. On New Year's Eve, Arthur and D.W. are determined to stay up till midnight to see what happens.

Last Tango in Halifax

Season 1, Episode Six

Celia takes the news about Caroline and Kate badly. She is extremely rude to Kate during a dinner with Alan and Caroline. Alan is shocked and saddened, declaring he will call off the wedding with Celia.

Odd Squad

Hold the Door/Flatastrophe

An agent in training gets lost in headquarters, Olive and Otto must find him before Ms. O finds out. Olive and Otto must stop Fladam, a villain with a vendetta against cubes.

Inside Louisville

Inside Baseball with Louisville Slugger and Louisville Bats

The Louisville Slugger bat is an American icon and a Louisville treasure. Learn the history behind the famous bat, visit the museum and factory in downtown Louisville and hear from the president of the city's minor league baseball team, the Louisville Bats. A 2024 KET production.

Wild Kratts

Chameleons on Target

Aviva makes a ring chip to super power her "inventuring," but it is stolen by a mysterious lemur. Martin and Chris are off to the rescue and along the way, they learn about the amazing world of chameleons.

Kentucky Life

Bluegrass Barons Vintage Baseball; Casey Jones Distillery; Highland Renaissance Festival; Lemonjuice McGee's Comic Cavalcade

Our friend Doug Flynn learns about the Bluegrass Barons and vintage baseball; Casey Jones Distillery in Hopkinsville specializes in moonshine; hosted by the Kentucky Renaissance Faire, the Highland Renaissance Festival in Eminence is an annual tradition; Lemonjuice McGee's Comic Cavalcade in Somerset is home to a wide selection of toys, comic books and more.

Headwaters: Real Stories from Rural America

The Ralph Stanley Story

Explores Stanley's musical roots in the Clinch Mountains of Virginia, the early days of the Stanley Brothers, and Ralph's decision to continue on after the untimely death of brother Carter. Interviews with Stanley, former band members, and fellow musicians such as Patty Loveless and Dwight Yoakam are intercut with performance excerpts, including several with Larry Sparks and Ricky Skaggs at Skaggs' annual Hills of Home Bluegrass Festival. A 2003 Production.

Lyla in the Loop

How to Hamster/A Bad Case of the Beeps

It is Luke's turn with the hamsters and he's planning the best weekend ever. The Loops embark on a journey to figure out why Stu is mysteriously beeping.

Tim Farmer's Country Kitchen (KET)

Greek Casserole, Greek Street Bread

What to do with all that zucchini? How about a Greek Casserole? Lasagna noodles, zucchini, mozzarella and gyro meat make a unique dish sure to please. Knead some Greek Street Bread to dip in all the drippings for the perfect meal. A 2024 production.

Kentucky Afield

Grabbing Catfish, Hunting Dogs, Deer Archery Hunt

Chad and some friends are on Kentucky Lake catching catfish by hand, a veterinarian shares information about how to keep hunting dogs in top shape and look back at a deer bow hunt. A 2024 production.

Hero Elementary

Teacher of the Year; The Sweet Smell of Success

Mr. Sparks is receiving the "Hero Teacher of the Year" award and the students want to make a cake. The team tries to track it down a missing cake via their sense of smell.

Connections

Sarah Taylor Vanover - Early Childhood Education

Renee Shaw talks with early childhood education expert Sarah Taylor Vanover, Ed.D., about why America's childcare industry is on the verge of collapse and what can be done to save it. Vanover is the author of "America's Child-Care Crisis: Rethinking an Essential Business."

Let's Go Luna!

Where's Luna?/Pulling Strings

When Luna goes missing in Delhi, Andy tracks her down using her hat and an ancient astronomy site. Leo and Luna put on a traditional Kathputli puppet show that helps Andy and Carmen learn to get along.

Facing an Uncomfortable Truth

The film explores the role of African Americans in the early years of the Catholic Church in Kentucky from those who were enslaved and worked in growing the denomination to individuals that endured second-class citizenship. It also examines how Black Catholics in Kentucky are finding their voices today.

Clifford the Big Red Dog

The March of the Sea Turtles/A Squirrely Situation

The baby sea turtles have hatched, but instead of crawling into the ocean, they are walking around town! Cozy things keep disappearing from Clifford's doghouse, and a squirrel may be to blame.

Dinosaur Train

That's Not a Dinosaur/Tiny's Garden

While attempting to win the leaf-necklace contest at the Biome Block Party, Keenan Chirostemotes claims the Pteranodon sibs can't compete for the prize for "dinosaur" with the most leaves because they are not dinosaurs. The Nature Trackers go on a visit to the Big Pond, where Tiny hopes to see her favorite flowers.

Molly of Denali

By Sled or Snowshoe/The Shortest Birthday

Molly persuades Tooey and her mom to bring a camera up the mountain when an active volcano erupts. Molly and Tooey have planned the perfect present for Trini's birthday, which happens to fall on the winter solstice.

Mecha Builders

The Treasure of Treetop Woods/Zee Makes an Amazing Maze

Ranger Nat's hike through Treetop Woods turns to adventure when he stumbles upon a treasure map, but he doesn't know how to read it, Zee and MacBarn set up their corn maze with the help of Zee Mobile - until it breaks down inside the maze.

Wild Kratts

The Food Chain Game

Aviva wants to build a food web for the African savannah, so she devises a game and Martin and Chris accept her challenge! They will each start as a blade of grass and climb to the top of the food web in a game of "Power Suit Creature Tag."

Appalshop @ 40: Classics from the Collection

Long Journey Home

This documentary dispels this myth of a "pure Anglo-Saxon" Appalachia as it explores the ethnic diversity of the region, the economic forces causing people to migrate into and out of the area, and the personal choices individuals make to stay, to leave, and to come back. A 2011 Production.

Curious George

George and the Sleepy Sheep/Gummy Monkey

It's New Year's Eve and George is so excited he can't sleep, so he tries to count sheep to get some sleep. George has chewing gum in his hair and gets glued to some flowers.

bookclub@ket

Payne Hollow: Life on the Fringe of Society

Host Bill Goodman and a panel of readers discuss Harlan and Anna Hubbard's simple life on the Ohio River in Trimble County. Eschewing electricity, telephones, and other trappings of the 20th century, the Hubbards tended their garden, fished the river, and lived lives akin to those of settlers a century earlier. A 2002 KET production.

Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood

Looking for Snowball/Daniel's Neighbors Help

Snowball, the class pet, has gone missing! All the neighbors band together to search for Snowball. The Tiger Family is under the weather! Lucky for them, their neighbors bring them soup, books, and encouragement to help them feel better.

Inside Louisville

Inside Baseball with Louisville Slugger and Louisville Bats

The Louisville Slugger bat is an American icon and a Louisville treasure. Learn the history behind the famous bat, visit the museum and factory in downtown Louisville and hear from the president of the city's minor league baseball team, the Louisville Bats. A 2024 KET production.

Daniel Tiger's Neighborhood

It's Time to Go/Daniel Doesn't Want to Stop Playing

Katerina and Daniel have trouble leaving the Treehouse because they are having so much fun playing. Daniel doesn't want to stop playing "Trolley" with Mom and Dad to work on his school project.

Kentucky Life

Bluegrass Barons Vintage Baseball; Casey Jones Distillery; Highland Renaissance Festival; Lemonjuice McGee's Comic Cavalcade

Our friend Doug Flynn learns about the Bluegrass Barons and vintage baseball; Casey Jones Distillery in Hopkinsville specializes in moonshine; hosted by the Kentucky Renaissance Faire, the Highland Renaissance Festival in Eminence is an annual tradition; Lemonjuice McGee's Comic Cavalcade in Somerset is home to a wide selection of toys, comic books and more.

Curious George

George Lights Up The Night/George and the Jug Owl

George and the Man With the Yellow Hat become stranded at sea when their boat runs out of gas. George thinks he has discovered a new creature - a jug owl.

Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum

I Am James Braidwood / I Am Queen Lili' Oukalani

James Braidwood explains to Brad that being prepared can help him stay calm when he is feeling nervous. Xavier and Yadina learn that being responsible can involve making hard choices.

Growing a Greener World

Gardening on the Cheap: Top Tips for Saving Money and Time in the Garden (Atlanta, GA)

Host Joe Lamp'l shares some of his best tips for saving you time and money in and around the garden.

Connections

Sarah Taylor Vanover - Early Childhood Education

Renee Shaw talks with early childhood education expert Sarah Taylor Vanover, Ed.D., about why America's childcare industry is on the verge of collapse and what can be done to save it. Vanover is the author of "America's Child-Care Crisis: Rethinking an Essential Business."

Tim Farmer's Country Kitchen (KET)

Greek Casserole, Greek Street Bread

What to do with all that zucchini? How about a Greek Casserole? Lasagna noodles, zucchini, mozzarella and gyro meat make a unique dish sure to please. Knead some Greek Street Bread to dip in all the drippings for the perfect meal. A 2024 production.

The Farmer & The Foodie

Maker's Mark Distillery

Maggie and Lindsey go to Maker's Mark distillery to learn from president Rob Samuels about the role of regenerative farming practices to produce the corn and wheat used in making bourbon. They visit Star Hill Provisions, the distillery's restaurant, and meet its executive chef, AuCo Lai.

Tim Farmer's Country Kitchen (KET)

Greek Casserole, Greek Street Bread

What to do with all that zucchini? How about a Greek Casserole? Lasagna noodles, zucchini, mozzarella and gyro meat make a unique dish sure to please. Knead some Greek Street Bread to dip in all the drippings for the perfect meal. A 2024 production.

Elinor Wonders Why

Leave It to Ari; Snow Friend

Elinor, Olive, and Ari head to the forest to take a closer look at leaves. Elinor, Ari, and Olive build a giant snow friend, but it falls apart because they don't have enough snow.

Headwaters: Real Stories from Rural America

The Ralph Stanley Story

Explores Stanley's musical roots in the Clinch Mountains of Virginia, the early days of the Stanley Brothers, and Ralph's decision to continue on after the untimely death of brother Carter. Interviews with Stanley, former band members, and fellow musicians such as Patty Loveless and Dwight Yoakam are intercut with performance excerpts, including several with Larry Sparks and Ricky Skaggs at Skaggs' annual Hills of Home Bluegrass Festival. A 2003 Production.

Rosie's Rules

Trouble in Chalk Town/Story Time Garden

Rosie and Javi make a chalk town in the circle drive, but things take a turn when others want to use the space too. Rosie wants to fix the community garden, but it turns out to be harder than she thought.

Arthur

Lend Me Your Ear/The Butler Did It

Arthur, Buster, and Brain are worried when Mr. Ratburn isn't acting like himself. He's always pleased to see them! When Mr. Crosswire gets a robot butler for Father's Day, Muffy fears Bailey may be replaced.

Connections

Sarah Taylor Vanover - Early Childhood Education

Renee Shaw talks with early childhood education expert Sarah Taylor Vanover, Ed.D., about why America's childcare industry is on the verge of collapse and what can be done to save it. Vanover is the author of "America's Child-Care Crisis: Rethinking an Essential Business."

Xavier Riddle and the Secret Museum

I Am Louis Braille / I Am Zaha Hadid

Louis Braille explains to Brad that there are many ways to read. Xavier, Yadina and Brad are inspired to build their treehouse in their own unique way.

Kentucky Life

Outdoors-Themed Program

Each year thousands of migrating Sandhill Cranes congregate at Barren River Lake; the vibrant springtime display of wildflowers at John James Audubon State Park in Henderson; hikers of all ages and skill levels enjoy 40 miles of trails at Shaker Village of Pleasant Hill; and Popes Creek Ranch in Lebanon offers opportunities for 'glamping' - glamour camping. A 2015 KET Production.

Kentucky Afield

Grabbing Catfish, Hunting Dogs, Deer Archery Hunt

Chad and some friends are on Kentucky Lake catching catfish by hand, a veterinarian shares information about how to keep hunting dogs in top shape and look back at a deer bow hunt. A 2024 production.

Louisville's Olmsted Parks

Frederick Law Olmsted designed Central Park in New York City and hundreds of parks nationwide, but you can find what's been called the defining park system of his career in Louisville. Composed of 18 parks and six parkways, Louisville's Olmsted Park system is not only pastoral and full of activities, it brims with historical links and footnotes. Jackie Hays, a veteran broadcaster in Louisville, narrates this special. A 2015 KET production.

Nature Cat

The Grand Mystery of the Grand Canyon/Strongest Show on Earth

The group visits the Grand Canyon to find out how it was created. Nature Cat and his friends try to figure out who is the strongest.

Arthur

I'm a Poet/The Scare-Your-Pants-Off Club

Fern challenges everyone to enter a poetry contest judged by a famous poet. Arthur and the gang fight back when a group called Parents Against Weird Stories wants to ban their favorite ghost-story books from the library.

Connections

Sarah Taylor Vanover - Early Childhood Education

Renee Shaw talks with early childhood education expert Sarah Taylor Vanover, Ed.D., about why America's childcare industry is on the verge of collapse and what can be done to save it. Vanover is the author of "America's Child-Care Crisis: Rethinking an Essential Business."

Odd Squad

Dance Like Nobody is Watching/Recipe for Disaster

The HQ alarm system is triggered, forcing Olive, Otto, Ms. O and Oscar to navigate a series of booby traps in order to shut it off. Olive and Otto each explain to Ms. O why a case went wrong.

Facing an Uncomfortable Truth

The film explores the role of African Americans in the early years of the Catholic Church in Kentucky from those who were enslaved and worked in growing the denomination to individuals that endured second-class citizenship. It also examines how Black Catholics in Kentucky are finding their voices today.

Wild Kratts

Sea Otter Swim

When the Wild Kratts take time out for a swim, Jimmy reveals that he's not that strong a swimmer. Martin and Chris get him his own personal swimming tutor - a sea otter named Coach!

Kentucky Life

Outdoors-Themed Program

Each year thousands of migrating Sandhill Cranes congregate at Barren River Lake; the vibrant springtime display of wildflowers at John James Audubon State Park in Henderson; hikers of all ages and skill levels enjoy 40 miles of trails at Shaker Village of Pleasant Hill; and Popes Creek Ranch in Lebanon offers opportunities for 'glamping' - glamour camping. A 2015 KET Production.

Kentucky Afield

Grabbing Catfish, Hunting Dogs, Deer Archery Hunt

Chad and some friends are on Kentucky Lake catching catfish by hand, a veterinarian shares information about how to keep hunting dogs in top shape and look back at a deer bow hunt. A 2024 production.

Hero Elementary

The Feed for Speed / An Uphill Task

Fur Blur competes in the school's Super Pet Races, but is she ready to race? AJ invents a wheeled robot that can do everything except go up stairs.

Doc Martin

Season 9, Episode Five: Wild West Country

Martin investigates a local farmer after he shoots Robert for stealing some of his eggs. Meanwhile, Emily returns to the surgery to see Martin after her acne medication causes a bad reaction and a secret bidder buys the Crab and Lobster pub.

Tim Farmer's Country Kitchen (KET)

Greek Casserole, Greek Street Bread

What to do with all that zucchini? How about a Greek Casserole? Lasagna noodles, zucchini, mozzarella and gyro meat make a unique dish sure to please. Knead some Greek Street Bread to dip in all the drippings for the perfect meal. A 2024 production.

It also examines how Black Catholics in Kentucky are finding their voices today.
